# bytesPerIndex

**Instance Property**

The number of bytes that represent each index value in the element’s data.

## Declaration

```swift
var bytesPerIndex: Int { get }
```

## Discussion

An element’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNGeometryElement/data] property holds an array of index values identifying vertices in a geometry source. SceneKit interprets the data as an array of unsigned integers, whose size is specified by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNGeometryElement/bytesPerIndex] property.

## Working with Indexes

- **data**: The data describing the geometry element.
- **primitiveType**: The drawing primitive that connects vertices when rendering the geometry element.
- **SCNGeometryPrimitiveType**: The drawing primitive that connects vertices when rendering a geometry element, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNGeometryElement/primitiveType] property to specify how SceneKit interprets the geometry element’s data.
- **primitiveCount**: The number of primitives in the element.
- **primitiveRange**: The range of primitives from the geometry element to render.
